text1: Youths w/ clinical anxiety exhibit distinct brain activation states during socioemotional processing, spending more time in a state associated with high ventral attention and default mode network activation when viewing negative content. https://t.co/jyrPGZ3jsK @BarchDbarch https://t.co/T02oJUqj8K
text2:
New research on youth anxiety! 🧠 We identified 3 distinct brain activation states during socioemotional processing using fMRI in 620 youths (5-15yrs).  Higher generalized anxiety linked to more time in a "default mode" state during negative stimuli.  Implications for intervention!

👉🏾**#YouthAnxiety**: 620 participants
👉🏽**#fMRI**: 3 distinct brain states identified
👉🏼**#DefaultModeNetwork**: Increased time in this state linked to higher anxiety
👉🏻**#SocioemotionalProcessing**:  Study used movie stimuli
👉🏾**#Intervention**: Implications for novel treatment approaches

text1: Most viewed in the last 7 days from @JAMAPsych: [this is a newline]Low expectations of escitalopram predicted better efficacy for psilocybin in treating major depressive disorder. [this is a newline]https://t.co/yFkvlXMOsH https://t.co/Lm6eKzbwAD
text2: New research on treatment expectancies in #psilocybin vs #escitalopram trials for depression! 🤯  We analyzed pre-randomization expectancy data (0-100% improvement scale) from the Carhart-Harris et al. study, revealing crucial insights into the impact of expectations on outcomes.  Read our paper to learn more!  #ClinicalTrials 🧪 #DepressionResearch 🧠 #PsilocybinTherapy 🍄

text1: Most medical conditions are associated with an increased risk of suicide in a dose-response manner, with the risk being particularly elevated for individuals with prior mental disorders. https://t.co/cWp8BkdkCE https://t.co/GEepgmI5kg
text2:
New research on suicide risk!  We analyzed data from 6,635,857 individuals in Denmark (2000-2020) and found that most medical conditions significantly increased suicide risk.  A dose-response relationship was observed for those without prior mental disorders.  Read more: [link to paper]

➡️#SuicideRisk 🏥  #MedicalConditions 📈 #Denmark 🇩🇰 #IRR1.7 (Gastrointestinal)

text1: YAWNS NB RCT: YAWNS-1, a simple, scalable, direct-to-patient intervention, reduced benzodiazepine receptor agonist use and improved sleep outcomes. https://t.co/o39Y4azaOu https://t.co/oCmbceO9Xp
text2:
New study shows a simple, mailed intervention significantly reduced BZRA use in older adults!  YAWNS-1 led to a 46.6% reduction in BZRA use & improved sleep. Check out our RCT:

🛌 **BZRA Reduction:** 46.6% with YAWNS-1!
😴 **Sleep Improvement:** Significant improvements in sleep efficiency.
📈 **CBTI Uptake:** YAWNS-1 showed superior CBTI technique uptake (3.1 vs 2.4).
👤 **Direct-to-Patient:** Scalable & impactful intervention.
🏥 **Older Adults:** Focus on improving insomnia care for the aging population.

#Insomnia #SleepDisorders #BZRA #CBTI #RCT

text1: Viewpoint describes both the current barriers patients face when filling their prescriptions for buprenorphine at pharmacies and a list of proposed fixes requiring changes at the federal, state, insurance, and clinician level. https://t.co/G54Akf5AIi https://t.co/IS5AnAbJzF
text2:
New research in JAMA Psychiatry reveals significant barriers to accessing buprenorphine, a life-saving medication for opioid use disorder.  A West Virginia study found 34% of patients had trouble filling prescriptions in the past year!  This is impacting patient recovery & increasing overdose risk. Let's address these systemic issues.

💊 #BuprenorphineAccess: 34% filling issues
📈 #OpioidOverdose: 50% risk reduction with buprenorphine
👨‍⚕️ #ClinicianWaiverEliminated:  Increased prescribers from 37,869 to 98,344 (2017-2020)
🤔 #PharmacyBarriers:  Supplier caps, SORS reports, & insurance hurdles
🗺️ #RuralAccess: Disparities amplified in rural communities


[Link to the paper]

text1: Veterans with PTSD and obesity had substantially higher likelihood of accelerated GrimAge, suggesting a synergistic effect between these 2 conditions. https://t.co/KXhAIQu3Nt https://t.co/3Ebr6h5tAd
text2:
PTSD & obesity accelerate epigenetic aging in US military veterans! 💥  Our study of 1135 veterans showed a 3-fold increased risk of accelerated GrimAge with both PTSD & obesity.  🤯  Learn more: [link to paper]

#️⃣PTSD  (OR 1.92)
#️⃣Obesity (OR 3.83 interaction with PTSD)
#️⃣GrimAge (accelerated in 18.3% of veterans)
#️⃣EpigeneticAging
#️⃣Veterans (1135 participants)

text1: Private equity (PE) firms own nearly 30% of US opioid treatment programs, exceeding PE penetration in other sectors of health care. https://t.co/nR2IIfcYEX https://t.co/dhCYVjA3V8
text2: NEW RESEARCH: Private Equity's impact on US Opioid Treatment Programs.  Our study reveals 29.1% of OTPs are PE-owned, with significant market concentration.  PE-owned OTPs were more prevalent in areas with higher White populations & lower incomes. Implications for access & quality of care are significant. #PEinHealthcare 🏥 #OpioidCrisis💊 #AddictionTreatment 💉 #HealthEquity ⚖️ #MarketConcentration 📈

text1: Genome-wide association studies (GWAS) show limited correspondence between genetic risk factors and current psychiatric drug targets. https://t.co/gODg5okSzA https://t.co/NI4BDQocmG
text2:
New research links GWAS & pharmacological treatments for psychiatric disorders!  We investigated 4 disorders (ADHD, bipolar, schizophrenia, MDD) using 2232 DrugBank genes & 4 bioinformatic modalities.  Significant link found for bipolar disorder via PPI network (P-perm = 7 × 10⁻⁴).  Overall correspondence was low, suggesting distinct genetic architectures.

🤔#PsychiatricDisorders #GWAS #Pharmacology #Bioinformatics #PPINetwork

text1: This RCT found no group-level evidence supporting neurofeedback as a stand-alone treatment for ADHD. https://t.co/46jaxL8Wq0 https://t.co/wbONeTDBte
text2:
New meta-analysis on neurofeedback for ADHD!  🤔  38 RCTs (n=2472) showed no significant benefit overall.  However, a small positive effect was seen with standard protocols (SMD 0.21) and improved processing speed (SMD 0.35).  Implications for future research are discussed.

➡️ #ADHD 🧠 #Neurofeedback 📊 #MetaAnalysis 🔬 #SystematicReview 📚

text1: Brief cognitive-behavioral therapy (BCBT-inpatient), when added to standard care, significantly reduced suicide attempts and psychiatric readmissions in suicidal patients. https://t.co/9VJh5tfPeT https://t.co/KZinPwGgaB
text2: New RCT shows Brief Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (BCBT) for suicidal inpatients reduces post-discharge suicide attempts by 60%!  Read our findings: [link to paper]  #️⃣SuicidePrevention 🏥InpatientCare 🧠CBT  📉60%Reduction  🧑‍⚕️MentalHealth
